answers.answer:
Refugees in Romania are offered several types of support. These include access to "Law made simple" to help understand rights and obligations, and "PTSD Help" as a free assistant for managing Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.

Financial support is available, such as a Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation, which provides 750 RON per month for single individuals or 2,000 RON per month for families for up to three consecutive months. For those in more stabilized living situations or receiving additional government support, the amounts are 500 RON per month for individuals and 1,500 RON per month for families. After this period, beneficiaries may apply for a Minimum Inclusion Income as ongoing financial support. Additionally, refugees from Ukraine under temporary protection are eligible for other social benefits.

Assistance in finding housing is provided through the "Un Acoperiș" (A Roof) platform, which helps coordinate requests for free accommodation. Support is also available for individuals experiencing difficulties in submitting applications, including help from Romanian/English speakers, contact with NGOs, and call centers with Ukrainian-Russian-Romanian speakers, as well as specific government and organizational helplines.

answers.answer: Yes, financial assistance is available for refugee accommodation in Romania. Beneficiaries of temporary protection may be eligible for a monthly lump sum to cover accommodation expenses for up to 3 consecutive months, starting July 1, 2024. This financial support is outlined in Government Emergency Ordinance No. 96/2024. The payment is 750 RON per month for a single individual and 2,000 RON per month for families. In special cases, such as those receiving additional government support or housed in temporary accommodation camps, the assistance is 500 RON per month for individuals and 1,500 RON per month for families.

answers.answer:
Refugees in Romania can find housing or temporary accommodation through two main avenues. Firstly, beneficiaries of temporary protection may be eligible for a monthly lump sum to cover accommodation expenses for up to 3 consecutive months, starting July 1, 2024. This payment is 750 RON per month for a single individual and 2,000 RON per month for families, with reduced amounts for special cases. To apply, beneficiaries must submit a valid temporary protection permit, passports for each family member, bank account details, and other requested documents to their local administrative-territorial unit.

Secondly, for help finding free accommodation, refugees can use the platform "Un Acoperiș (A Roof)". Through this platform, central authorities and international organizations coordinate requests and available accommodation to provide housing based on individual needs.

answers.answer: Refugees can access "PTSD Help," which is described as a free assistant for managing Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). While specific contact information for this assistant is not provided, refugees experiencing difficulties, including those related to PTSD, can get in touch with an NGO that has Ukrainian-Russian-Romanian speakers, contact a call center with Ukrainian-Russian-Romanian speakers, or call the government call center at 021.3456789 (available between 08:00 and 16:00). Additionally, UNHCR Romania can be reached at +40 723 653 651 and CNRR at +40 730 073 170 for support.
